common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failures
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch on Linux, macOS, and Windows.  Common symptoms include freezing, boot-up issues, and getting stuck on dependency checks. Solutions varied: Linux users resolved freezing by disabling virtual keyboards, while Windows users found success after a patch addressed stricter hardware requirements in v11.1.1. Providing logs is crucial for diagnosis.

related_issues.title: Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
related_issues.text:
Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces app goes unresponsive and freezes a lot when trying to do anything, like trying to type in copilot chat or navigating through the menus. Can't use pieces app at all! Tried reinstalling it, but it made no difference. Desktop app version is 3.3.6

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e75595c0-31c8-4560-b08b-9ad3de8af6ab
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User (@94tejas) reported an issue with the Pieces app freezing on Linux Mint.
* Pieces support bot suggested related issues and resources.
* Mack (@mack-at-pieces) identified the issue as a known Flutter bug related to TextFields on specific Linux Mint versions (https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/153560).
* User confirmed that disabling the virtual keyboard in accessibility settings resolved the issue.

**Solutions:**

* Disable the virtual keyboard in accessibility settings.

**Outcome:**

* The issue is resolved for the user, but a long-term fix is still needed for the underlying Flutter bug.

**Current Status:**

* The Flutter bug has not yet been fixed. Pieces team is waiting for a fix from Flutter and will patch the app accordingly.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Key Points of the Conversation

* **Issue:** PiecesOS taking a long time to boot (stuck on 'dependencies scenario' tab)
* **Platforms:** Windows, macOS
* **Identified problems:**
    * **Windows:**
        * Issues related to using older processors (pre-2015)
        * Potential conflicts with Atlas OS
        * User error in trying to fix by reinstalling Windows
    * **macOS:**
        * Issue not acknowledged in this conversation
* **Solutions proposed/implemented:**
    * **Windows:**
        * Installing a specific version of the appInstaller build
        * Troubleshooting specific issues based on user logs
        * Reinstalling Windows and removing Atlas OS
        * Reinstalling the latest version (11.1.1)
    * **macOS:**
        * No solutions proposed in this conversation
* **Current status/outcome:**
    * **Windows:**
        * Resolved for most users with the latest build (11.1.1)
        * One user still experiencing issues 
    * **macOS:**
        * Issue still not resolved for the user reporting the problem

## Notes

* The conversation contains a lot of back-and-forth communication between users and support representatives. 
* Some of the discussion is irrelevant to the original issue, such as Shamas-Habib's multiple comments hijacking rogierlegit's issue. 
* The summary focuses on the key points and information relevant to the original issue and its resolution.
* The current status/outcome section clearly states the outcome for both Windows and macOS users.

common_issues.title: Input Issues in Pieces Applications
common_issues.description: Users report various input-related issues in Pieces applications, including unexpected behavior of Home/End keys in Visual Studio extension and over-eager saving of conversation titles in the desktop app. Solutions involve investigating WebView2 behavior, releasing patches, and suggesting workarounds like using floating windows.

related_issues.title: Visual Studio Extension: Home and End keys should move the text cursor to the beginning and end of the input text box
related_issues.text:
Visual Studio Extension: Home and End keys should move the text cursor to the beginning and end of the input text box ### Discussed in https://github.com/pieces-app/support/discussions/476
Originally posted by **icnocop** November 25, 2024 Hi. Thank you for "Pieces for Developers". When using the Visual Studio extension, the input text box in the `Pieces Copilot` tab does not respond to the `Home` and `End` keys as expected. I expected the `Home` and `End` keys to move the text cursor to the beginning and end of the input text box, respectively. Instead, the `Home` and `End` keys switch to first and last tabs, respectively. For example, pressing the `Home` key switches to the `Solution Explorer` tab, which is also docked on the right side of the IDE. Pressing the `End` key switches to the `Notifications` tab, which is also docked on the right side of the IDE. If I had typed some text in the input text box, I expected to be able to jump to the beginning and end of the input text box, using the `Home` and `End` keys respectfully. ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6bd4b361-6f38-4a4a-9dfb-5de887074a82) Thank you. Pieces for Visual Studio 3.0.1.0 Visual Studio 2022 17.12.0
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key points raised:** * The user is experiencing issues with the Home and End keys not working correctly in a WebView2 within a WPF TabControl. * This issue may be related to the known behavior of WebView2 with Home and End keys in WPF TabControls. **Problems identified:** * Visual Studio's TabControl intercepts the Home and End keys before they reach the WebView2. * Marking the keypress event as handled prevents the TabControl from intercepting the keys, but also prevents them from reaching the WebView2. * Forwarding the keypress event to the WebView2 using JavaScript results in dropped keypresses and poor user experience. **Solutions proposed/implemented:** * The author investigated the potential solutions but did not find a satisfactory one yet. **Current status/outcome:** * The investigation is ongoing, and the author will update the issue when a proper solution is found. * The user is advised to use the Copilot window as a floating window instead of docked/tabbed to temporarily avoid the issue. **Additional resources:** * The comment provides links to related issues on the web and GitHub.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving Pieces OS launch failures:** This issue is widespread and causing significant user frustration. Focus on resolving the hardware incompatibility issue and provide clear guidance for affected users.
**Investigate and address Pieces Desktop Application bugs:**  Focus on resolving issues with conversation renaming, freezing on Linux, and boot-up problems on macOS.
**Improve communication around hardware requirements:** Clearly communicate the minimum hardware requirements for Pieces OS, especially AVX2 support, to prevent future installation issues.
**Gather more detailed logs for troubleshooting:** Request specific logs related to launch failures, freezing, and other common issues to help developers identify root causes faster.

**Consider a dedicated support channel for Pieces OS:** Given the volume and complexity of OS-related issues, a dedicated support channel could improve response times and provide more focused assistance.
